segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎来到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Katherine.
segments.cn: 我叫Katherine。

segments.en: And today we have a delicious lesson all about Chinese food for you.
segments.cn: 今天我们为你们准备了一堂关于中国美食的美味课程。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Today we are ordering Chinese food.
segments.cn: 今天我们要点中国菜。

segments.en: Now, for many of you listeners that are actually Chinese, you may not recognize these dishes because we are talking about American Chinese food.
segments.cn: 对于许多实际上是中国听众的你们来说，可能不太认识这些菜，因为我们在谈论的是美式中餐。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So long, long ago, people came over to America from mainly Hong Kong.
segments.cn: 很久很久以前，人们主要是从香港来到美国。

segments.en: And so a lot of the food we have is kind of more like Hong Kong food.
segments.cn: 所以我们有很多食物更像是香港的食物。

segments.en: Cantonese food.
segments.cn: 粤菜。

segments.en: Cantonese food, but it's also very American.
segments.cn: 粤菜，但它也非常美式。

segments.en: So let's take a listen to today's dialogue and find out exactly what we're eating.
segments.cn: 那么让我们来听听今天的对话，看看我们到底在吃什么。

segments.en: Hi, welcome to Happy Buddha.
segments.cn: 嗨，欢迎来到快乐佛。

segments.en: Can I get you anything to drink?
segments.cn: 我可以给你们点什么喝的吗？

segments.en: A Coke for me, please.
segments.cn: 给我来一杯可乐，谢谢。

segments.en: I'll have a Sprite.
segments.cn: 我要一杯雪碧。

segments.en: Okay, I'll go get that for you.
segments.cn: 好的，我去给你们拿。

segments.en: Are there any questions with the menu?
segments.cn: 菜单上有问题吗？

segments.en: Do you use MSG?
segments.cn: 你们用味精吗？

segments.en: No, ma'am.
segments.cn: 不，女士。

segments.en: We are MSG free.
segments.cn: 我们不含味精。

segments.en: Oh, man, I haven't had Chinese food in so long.
segments.cn: 哦，天哪，我好久没吃中餐了。

segments.en: I want everything.
segments.cn: 我想要所有的菜。

segments.en: This place has the best sesame chicken.
segments.cn: 这家店的芝麻鸡最好。

segments.en: Yeah, I've been craving Chinese for such a long time.
segments.cn: 是啊，我已经渴望中餐很久了。

segments.en: I used to get takeout all the time.
segments.cn: 我以前总是点外卖。

segments.en: It's definitely been a while.
segments.cn: 确实有一段时间了。

segments.en: Let's start off with some crab rangoon.
segments.cn: 我们先来点一些蟹角吧。

segments.en: Oh, yeah, that sounds good.
segments.cn: 哦，听起来不错。

segments.en: I think I'm going to get the sesame chicken with fried rice, a spring roll and egg drop soup.
segments.cn: 我想点芝麻鸡配炒饭，一个春卷和蛋花汤。

segments.en: It's so tempting to order everything on the menu.
segments.cn: 点菜单上的所有菜真让人心动。

segments.en: It all looks so appetizing.
segments.cn: 看起来都很美味。

segments.en: I think I'll get general toast chicken, hot and sour soup, fried wontons and white rice.
segments.cn: 我想点宫保鸡丁、酸辣汤、炸云吞和白米饭。

segments.en: Aren't you supposed to be on a diet?
segments.cn: 你不是应该在节食吗？

segments.en: You should at least get brown rice.
segments.cn: 你至少应该点糙米。

segments.en: I don't think so.
segments.cn: 我不这么认为。

segments.en: I hate brown rice.
segments.cn: 我讨厌糙米。

segments.en: And I'm so sick of eating healthy all the time.
segments.cn: 我真是厌倦了总是吃健康食品。

segments.en: I've been eating so much salad, I swear I've forgotten what meat tastes like.
segments.cn: 我吃了太多沙拉，发誓我已经忘记肉的味道了。

segments.en: There's no better remedy than some nice, greasy, calorie-laden Chinese food.
segments.cn: 没有什么比一些美味、油腻、热量高的中餐更能治愈了。

segments.en: I might even get an order of broccoli beef.
segments.cn: 我甚至可能会点一份西兰花牛肉。

segments.en: Oh, gosh, I'm so hungry.
segments.cn: 哦，天哪，我好饿。

segments.en: Let's call the waitress over.
segments.cn: 我们叫服务员过来吧。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: So obviously everything seems so good.
segments.cn: 显然一切看起来都很好。

segments.en: Very typical American Chinese dishes.
segments.cn: 非常典型的美式中餐。

segments.en: And we have a lot of things that we can take a look at.
segments.cn: 我们有很多东西可以看看。

segments.en: So let's start with language takeaway.
segments.cn: 那么让我们开始语言学习。

segments.en: Language takeaway.
segments.cn: 语言学习。

segments.en: In language takeaway today, we're going to be talking about some general food words, words that you can use when you're ordering food.
segments.cn: 在今天的语言学习中，我们将讨论一些常见的食物词汇，点餐时可以使用的词汇。

segments.en: So the first one we should talk about is this MSG.
segments.cn: 所以我们首先要谈的是味精。

segments.en: Right, Andrea asks, do you use MSG?
segments.cn: 对，Andrea问，你们用味精吗？

segments.en: So why is she asking this, and what is MSG?
segments.cn: 那么她为什么问这个，味精是什么？

segments.en: MSG is an ingredient in foods.
segments.cn: 味精是食品中的一种成分。

segments.en: It's kind of like a condiment, something that you put on the food after the food has been cooked.
segments.cn: 它有点像调味品，是在食物烹饪后放在上面的东西。

segments.en: And it makes the food taste better, brighter.
segments.cn: 它使食物的味道更好，更鲜明。

segments.en: It intensifies the flavors a little bit.
segments.cn: 它稍微增强了味道。

segments.en: Yeah, and it looks like salt or sugar.
segments.cn: 是的，它看起来像盐或糖。

segments.en: It's on the tables usually at Chinese restaurants.
segments.cn: 通常在中餐馆的桌子上都有。

segments.en: But a lot of people don't like MSG because they don't think it's very safe for their bodies.
segments.cn: 但很多人不喜欢味精，因为他们认为对身体不太安全。

segments.en: And so actually the waitress says that the food is MSG free, which means there's no MSG in it.
segments.cn: 所以实际上服务员说食物不含味精，这意味着里面没有味精。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Okay, so she says our food is MSG free, which is this chemical.
segments.cn: 好的，她说我们的食物不含味精，这种化学物质。

segments.en: I think it's kind of like a chemical that you describe.
segments.cn: 我认为这是一种你描述的化学物质。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And a lot of people don't want it.
segments.cn: 很多人不想要它。

segments.en: So you can ask, is this food MSG free?
segments.cn: 所以你可以问，这道菜不含味精吗？

segments.en: You can also ask, is it fat free?
segments.cn: 你也可以问，它是无脂的吗？

segments.en: Is it salt free?
segments.cn: 是无盐的吗？

segments.en: So this is a very helpful way of asking about what the ingredients are in a dish.
segments.cn: 所以这是询问菜肴成分的一个非常有用的方法。

segments.en: That's right, that's right.
segments.cn: 没错，没错。

segments.en: And actually Manny is talking about the food as well.
segments.cn: 实际上Manny也在谈论食物。

segments.en: And he says, yeah, I've been craving Chinese for such a long time.
segments.cn: 他说，是的，我已经渴望中餐很久了。

segments.en: Okay, so the verb here is to crave, but he said he's been craving.
segments.cn: 好的，这里的动词是渴望，但他说他一直在渴望。

segments.en: So he really has been wanting this food for a long time.
segments.cn: 所以他真的很想吃这道食物很久了。

segments.en: So if you say I'm craving Italian food, what does that mean?
segments.cn: 所以如果你说我渴望意大利食物，这是什么意思？

segments.en: That means I really want to eat Italian food.
segments.cn: 这意味着我真的想吃意大利食物。

segments.en: You feel like having Italian food.
segments.cn: 你想吃意大利食物。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So I'm craving some kind of food.
segments.cn: 所以我渴望某种食物。

segments.en: I really want to eat it.
segments.cn: 我真的想吃它。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: And he said that he used to get takeout all the time.
segments.cn: 他还说他以前总是点外卖。

segments.en: So he's obviously talking about Chinese food.
segments.cn: 所以他显然在谈论中餐。

segments.en: What does he mean by takeout?
segments.cn: 他所说的外卖是什么意思？

segments.en: Well, takeout is the opposite of sitting down in a restaurant and eating food.
segments.cn: 外卖是坐在餐厅里吃饭的反义词。

segments.en: Takeout is what you do when you want to go home and eat it.
segments.cn: 外卖是你想回家吃的食物。

segments.en: So in many restaurants, you can order the food and then you go and you pick up the food and you bring it home.
segments.cn: 所以在许多餐厅，你可以点食物，然后去取食物带回家。

segments.en: Okay, so that's takeout.
segments.cn: 好的，这就是外卖。

segments.en: So it's a noun.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个名词。

segments.en: You get takeout.
segments.cn: 你点外卖。

segments.en: Right, but it's a little bit different from a different kind of takeout.
segments.cn: 对，但这与另一种外卖有点不同。

segments.en: There's takeout where you order the food and you pick it up and you bring it home.
segments.cn: 有外卖是你点食物然后去取回家。

segments.en: But there's also delivery.
segments.cn: 但还有送餐。

segments.en: And delivery is when you order the food and someone else brings it to you.
segments.cn: 送餐是你点食物，然后别人把它送到你那里。

segments.en: So be careful with those two.
segments.cn: 所以要小心这两者。

segments.en: All right, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: And moving forward, and moving forward, Manny kept talking about the food and said, wow, everything on the menu looks so appetizing.
segments.cn: 继续，Manny继续谈论食物，说，哇，菜单上的所有东西看起来都很美味。

segments.en: It all looks so appetizing.
segments.cn: 看起来都很美味。

segments.en: Okay, appetizing is a way to describe something.
segments.cn: 好的，美味是形容某物的方式。

segments.en: In this case, we're describing food.
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，我们在描述食物。

segments.en: So that's normally how we use the word appetizing.
segments.cn: 所以这就是我们通常使用“美味”这个词的方式。

segments.en: So appetizing basically means that you're excited about eating this food because it looks like it will be good.
segments.cn: 所以美味基本上意味着你对吃这道食物感到兴奋，因为它看起来会很好吃。

segments.en: So what about the word appetizer?
segments.cn: 那么开胃菜这个词呢？

segments.en: Does this have anything to do with it?
segments.cn: 这和它有什么关系吗？

segments.en: I think appetizer is something that makes you want to eat more.
segments.cn: 我认为开胃菜是让你想吃更多的东西。

segments.en: That's why it's at the beginning of a meal.
segments.cn: 所以它在一顿饭的开始。

segments.en: You have your appetizer before you have your main course.
segments.cn: 你在主菜之前有开胃菜。

segments.en: But the word appetizing means that, you know, it's very appealing.
segments.cn: 但“美味”这个词意味着，它非常吸引人。

segments.en: You really want to eat it.
segments.cn: 你真的想吃它。

segments.en: It looks good.
segments.cn: 看起来很好。

segments.en: It looks delicious.
segments.cn: 看起来很美味。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: And Andrea was worried because Manny is ordering so much food.
segments.cn: 安德里亚很担心，因为曼尼点了很多食物。

segments.en: She asks, aren't you supposed to be on a diet?
segments.cn: 她问，你不是应该在节食吗？

segments.en: Okay, so this is a phrase and I want to remind everyone to keep this phrase in mind.
segments.cn: 好的，这是一句短语，我想提醒大家记住这句话。

segments.en: You can, you can diet, which is a verb, but in this case, you're on a diet.
segments.cn: 你可以节食，这是一个动词，但在这种情况下，你在节食。

segments.en: So it's a noun.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个名词。

segments.en: I'm on a diet.
segments.cn: 我在节食。

segments.en: I'm trying to eat healthily.
segments.cn: 我在努力健康饮食。

segments.en: I'm trying to watch the things that I put in my body.
segments.cn: 我在注意我放进身体的东西。

segments.en: So usually if you're on a diet, you don't eat really greasy, fatty, take out Chinese food.
segments.cn: 所以通常如果你在节食，你不会吃非常油腻、肥腻的外卖中餐。

segments.en: You eat salads and soups.
segments.cn: 你吃沙拉和汤。

segments.en: Okay, so you are on a diet.
segments.cn: 好的，所以你在节食。

segments.en: Yes, he's on a diet or I was on a diet, but I stopped.
segments.cn: 是的，他在节食，或者我曾经在节食，但我停止了。

segments.en: All right, a lot of great, appealing food.
segments.cn: 好的，很多美味、诱人的食物。

segments.en: Why don't we go and listen to our dialogue again.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不再听一次对话。

segments.en: And we'll be back with language takeaway part two, where we're going to take a look at the specific American Chinese dishes.
segments.cn: 我们将回到语言要点第二部分，我们将看看具体的美式中餐。

segments.en: Hi, welcome to Happy Buddha.
segments.cn: 嗨，欢迎来到快乐佛。

segments.en: Can I get you anything to drink?
segments.cn: 我可以给你们点什么喝的吗？

segments.en: Coke for me, please.
segments.cn: 请给我可乐。

segments.en: I'll have a Sprite.
segments.cn: 我要一杯雪碧。

segments.en: Okay, I'll go get that for you.
segments.cn: 好的，我去给你们拿。

segments.en: Are there any questions with the menu?
segments.cn: 菜单上有问题吗？

segments.en: Do you use MSG?
segments.cn: 你们用味精吗？

segments.en: No, ma'am.
segments.cn: 不，女士。

segments.en: We are MSG free.
segments.cn: 我们不含味精。

segments.en: Oh man, I haven't had Chinese food in so long.
segments.cn: 哦，天哪，我好久没吃中餐了。

segments.en: I want everything.
segments.cn: 我想要一切。

segments.en: This place has the best sesame chicken.
segments.cn: 这个地方的芝麻鸡最好。

segments.en: Yeah, I've been craving Chinese for such a long time.
segments.cn: 是的，我已经渴望中餐很久了。

segments.en: I used to get takeout all the time.
segments.cn: 我以前总是点外卖。

segments.en: It's definitely been a while.
segments.cn: 确实有一段时间了。

segments.en: Let's start off with some crab rangoon.
segments.cn: 我们先来点蟹角。

segments.en: Oh yeah, that sounds good.
segments.cn: 哦，是的，听起来不错。

segments.en: I think I'm going to get the sesame chicken with fried rice, a spring roll, and egg drop soup.
segments.cn: 我想我要芝麻鸡配炒饭，一个春卷和蛋花汤。

segments.en: It's so tempting to order everything on the menu.
segments.cn: 点菜单上的所有东西真是太诱人了。

segments.en: It all looks so appetizing.
segments.cn: 一切看起来都很美味。

segments.en: I think I'll get General Tso's chicken, hot and sour soup, fried wontons, and white rice.
segments.cn: 我想我会点左宗棠鸡，酸辣汤，炸云吞和白米饭。

segments.en: Aren't you supposed to be on a diet?
segments.cn: 你不是应该在节食吗？

segments.en: You should at least get brown rice.
segments.cn: 你至少应该点糙米。

segments.en: I don't think so.
segments.cn: 我不这么认为。

segments.en: I hate brown rice.
segments.cn: 我讨厌糙米。

segments.en: And I'm so sick of eating healthy all the time.
segments.cn: 我真是厌倦了总是吃健康的食物。

segments.en: I've been eating so much salad, I swear I've forgotten what meat tastes like.
segments.cn: 我吃了太多沙拉，我发誓我已经忘记肉的味道。

segments.en: There's no better remedy than some nice, greasy, calorie-laden Chinese food.
segments.cn: 没有什么比一些美味、油腻、热量高的中餐更好的解药了。

segments.en: I might even get an order of broccoli beef.
segments.cn: 我甚至可能会点一份西兰花牛肉。

segments.en: Oh gosh, I'm so hungry.
segments.cn: 哦，天哪，我好饿。

segments.en: Let's call the waitress over.
segments.cn: 我们叫服务员过来吧。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: So now let's take a look at those delicious American Chinese dishes on Language Takeaway Part 2.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看语言要点第二部分中的那些美味的美式中餐。

segments.en: Language Takeaway And so here we are with a number of delicious and very appetizing dishes.
segments.cn: 语言要点 这里有许多美味且非常诱人的菜肴。

segments.en: These are things that you'll normally find in an American Chinese restaurant.
segments.cn: 这些是你通常会在美式中餐馆找到的东西。

segments.en: The first one is called crab rangoon.
segments.cn: 第一个叫蟹角。

segments.en: Okay, so this doesn't sound very Chinese at all.
segments.cn: 好的，这听起来一点也不中国。

segments.en: Now, a rangoon is actually a city in a country called Myanmar or Burma.
segments.cn: 现在，Rangoon实际上是一个位于缅甸的城市。

segments.en: And crab rangoon is a special deep-fried dish.
segments.cn: 蟹角是一种特别的油炸菜肴。

segments.en: It's like deep-fried dumplings, but on the inside there's cream cheese and crab.
segments.cn: 它像油炸饺子，但里面有奶酪和蟹肉。

segments.en: Uh -huh, crab meat.
segments.cn: 嗯，蟹肉。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: All right, so it's kind of, as you said, like a dumpling, but inside you have cream cheese and crab.
segments.cn: 好的，所以它有点像你说的饺子，但里面有奶酪和蟹。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: All right, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: Now, they also talked about getting the sesame chicken with fried rice.
segments.cn: 现在，他们还谈到了芝麻鸡配炒饭。

segments.en: Okay, so sesame is a very common ingredient in cultures all over the world.
segments.cn: 好的，芝麻是世界各地文化中非常常见的成分。

segments.en: And sesame is a kind of seed, but some people also use some sesame oil in their cooking.
segments.cn: 芝麻是一种种子，但有些人也在烹饪中使用芝麻油。

segments.en: And so these all come from these white, small seeds.
segments.cn: 所以这些都来自这些白色的小种子。

segments.en: And sesame chicken is a kind of chicken that's cooked with sesame seeds.
segments.cn: 芝麻鸡是一种用芝麻种子烹饪的鸡肉。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: And obviously we know what fried rice is.
segments.cn: 显然我们知道炒饭是什么。

segments.en: It's just basically rice in a pan with sometimes a little bit of meat and egg and just fry it all together.
segments.cn: 基本上就是在锅里炒的米饭，有时加一点肉和鸡蛋，一起炒。

segments.en: But what about spring rolls?
segments.cn: 但春卷呢？

segments.en: I think these are one of the typical Chinese dishes that everyone knows.
segments.cn: 我认为这些是每个人都知道的典型中餐。

segments.en: And actually it's a Chinese dish as well.
segments.cn: 实际上这也是一道中国菜。

segments.en: I love spring rolls, although I've never gotten an American spring roll in China.
segments.cn: 我喜欢春卷，尽管我在中国从未吃过美式春卷。

segments.en: The spring rolls we're talking about here are basically wrappers.
segments.cn: 我们在这里谈论的春卷基本上是包裹。

segments.en: These wonton wrappers that are stuffed with meat and vegetables.
segments.cn: 这些馄饨皮里塞满了肉和蔬菜。

segments.en: And they're rolled up so they look like a long roll.
segments.cn: 它们卷起来看起来像长卷。

segments.en: And they're deep fried.
segments.cn: 而且它们是油炸的。

segments.en: Okay, so spring rolls are, as you said, little rolls with meat and sometimes vegetable inside.
segments.cn: 好的，所以春卷是，正如你所说，里面有肉和有时有蔬菜的小卷。

segments.en: Not really sure why they call it spring roll though.
segments.cn: 不太确定为什么叫春卷。

segments.en: I don't know either.
segments.cn: 我也不知道。

segments.en: Maybe it has to do with the ingredients.
segments.cn: 也许和材料有关。

segments.en: Like they're vegetables from the spring.
segments.cn: 就像是春天的蔬菜。

segments.en: Maybe.
segments.cn: 也许吧。

segments.en: Now another one that I actually really, really like is this egg drop soup.
segments.cn: 现在我真的很喜欢的另一样是蛋花汤。

segments.en: This is delicious.
segments.cn: 这道菜很好吃。

segments.en: This is a very simple soup.
segments.cn: 这是一种非常简单的汤。

segments.en: And when you're cooking it, you break an egg and the egg is mixed into the soup.
segments.cn: 当你做的时候，你打一个蛋，蛋会混入汤里。

segments.en: So it looks like it's kind of got these yellow pieces floating.
segments.cn: 所以看起来有一些黄色的块漂浮着。

segments.en: But it's a really nice simple soup with egg.
segments.cn: 但这是一种很简单的蛋汤。

segments.en: Okay, and that's what it's called.
segments.cn: 好的，这就是它的名字。

segments.en: Egg drop soup.
segments.cn: 蛋花汤。

segments.en: Now, you mentioned the wonton wrappers and they also mentioned fried wontons.
segments.cn: 现在，你提到了云吞皮，他们也提到了炸云吞。

segments.en: What are wontons?
segments.cn: 云吞是什么？

segments.en: Okay, wontons are also known as hundun in mainland China.
segments.cn: 好的，云吞在中国大陆也叫馄饨。

segments.en: But this is a special kind of dumpling.
segments.cn: 但这是一种特殊的饺子。

segments.en: It's got a piece of dough, basically, that's flattened out.
segments.cn: 它基本上是一个被压扁的面团。

segments.en: And inside there's meat, maybe some vegetables.
segments.cn: 里面有肉，也许还有一些蔬菜。

segments.en: And sometimes you eat it in soup.
segments.cn: 有时你会在汤里吃。

segments.en: But here we're talking about fried wontons, deep fried wontons.
segments.cn: 但这里我们说的是炸云吞，油炸的云吞。

segments.en: So you put them in the deep fryer and they're fried so that they're crunchy and the insides are soft.
segments.cn: 所以你把它们放进油炸锅里，炸得酥脆，里面是软的。

segments.en: Actually, this is one of my favorite dishes.
segments.cn: 其实，这是我最喜欢的菜之一。

segments.en: The original one in China, though, as you said, the hundun.
segments.cn: 不过，正如你所说，原版在中国的馄饨。

segments.en: Because it's like in a soup.
segments.cn: 因为它是在汤里的。

segments.en: Yes.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: And it's very simple, but you have like dumplings in a soup.
segments.cn: 而且它非常简单，但你有像饺子一样的汤。

segments.en: But the fried ones are also very, very good.
segments.cn: 但炸的也很好吃。

segments.en: They are both delicious and this is making me very hungry.
segments.cn: 它们都很好吃，这让我很饿。

segments.en: So maybe we should listen to our dialogue again.
segments.cn: 所以也许我们应该再听一遍我们的对话。

segments.en: Hi, welcome to Happy Buddha.
segments.cn: 嗨，欢迎来到快乐佛。

segments.en: Can I get you anything to drink?
segments.cn: 我可以给你们点什么喝的吗？

segments.en: Uh, Coke for me, please.
segments.cn: 嗯，给我来一杯可乐。

segments.en: I'll have a Sprite.
segments.cn: 我要一杯雪碧。

segments.en: Okay, I'll go get that for you.
segments.cn: 好的，我去给你们拿。

segments.en: Are there any questions with the menu?
segments.cn: 菜单上有问题吗？

segments.en: Do you use MSG?
segments.cn: 你们用味精吗？

segments.en: No, ma'am, we are MSG free.
segments.cn: 不，女士，我们不含味精。

segments.en: Oh, man, I haven't had Chinese food in so long.
segments.cn: 哦，天哪，我好久没吃中餐了。

segments.en: I want everything.
segments.cn: 我想要所有的菜。

segments.en: This place has the best sesame chicken.
segments.cn: 这个地方的芝麻鸡最好吃。

segments.en: Yeah, I've been craving Chinese for such a long time.
segments.cn: 是的，我已经渴望中餐很久了。

segments.en: I used to get takeout all the time.
segments.cn: 我以前总是外卖。

segments.en: It's definitely been a while.
segments.cn: 确实有一段时间了。

segments.en: Let's start off with some crab rangoon.
segments.cn: 我们先来点蟹角吧。

segments.en: Oh, yeah, that sounds good.
segments.cn: 哦，是的，听起来不错。

segments.en: I think I'm going to get the sesame chicken with fried rice, a spring roll and egg drop soup.
segments.cn: 我想我要芝麻鸡配炒饭，一个春卷和蛋花汤。

segments.en: It's so tempting to order everything on the menu.
segments.cn: 点菜单上的所有菜真让人心动。

segments.en: It all looks so appetizing.
segments.cn: 看起来都很美味。

segments.en: I think I'll get general toast chicken, hot and sour soup, fried wontons and white rice.
segments.cn: 我想我要宫保鸡丁，酸辣汤，炸云吞和白米饭。

segments.en: Aren't you supposed to be on a diet?
segments.cn: 你不是应该在节食吗？

segments.en: You should at least get brown rice.
segments.cn: 你至少应该点糙米。

segments.en: I don't think so.
segments.cn: 我觉得不需要。

segments.en: I hate brown rice.
segments.cn: 我讨厌糙米。

segments.en: And I'm so sick of eating healthy all the time.
segments.cn: 我已经厌倦了总是吃健康的食物。

segments.en: I've been eating so much salad, I swear I've forgotten what meat tastes like.
segments.cn: 我吃了太多沙拉，发誓我已经忘记肉的味道。

segments.en: There's no better remedy than some nice, greasy, calorie-laden Chinese food.
segments.cn: 没有什么比一些美味、油腻、热量高的中餐更好的解药了。

segments.en: I might even get an order of broccoli beef.
segments.cn: 我甚至可能会点一份西兰花牛肉。

segments.en: Oh, gosh, I'm so hungry.
segments.cn: 哦，天哪，我好饿。

segments.en: Let's call the waitress over.
segments.cn: 我们叫服务员过来吧。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: So, as we mentioned, these dishes are very much...
segments.cn: 正如我们提到的，这些菜确实...

segments.en: they have a certain American influence to them.
segments.cn: 它们有一定的美国影响。

segments.en: And they're not really spicy.
segments.cn: 而且它们并不辣。

segments.en: I think that's the main difference as well.
segments.cn: 我认为这也是主要的区别。

segments.en: American Chinese food doesn't really have the intense garlic flavor, nor is it spicy like usual Chinese food.
segments.cn: 美国中餐并没有强烈的蒜味，也不像通常的中餐那样辣。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So I think that part of that is, like I said, due to the fact that a lot of the Chinese Americans who first came over came from Hong Kong.
segments.cn: 所以我认为部分原因是，正如我所说，很多最早来的华裔美国人来自香港。

segments.en: And so Hong Kong food is not as famous for its spiciness.
segments.cn: 所以香港的食物并不以辣闻名。

segments.en: It's not like Sichuan food.
segments.cn: 它不像四川菜。

segments.en: You will see a lot of sweet sauces, like this General Tso's chicken is like a very, very sweet sauce.
segments.cn: 你会看到很多甜酱，比如这个宫保鸡丁就是一种非常甜的酱。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: You'll also see a lot of soy sauce in American Chinese cooking.
segments.cn: 你还会在美国中餐中看到很多酱油。

segments.en: And so these are flavors that are very, very strong.
segments.cn: 所以这些味道非常强烈。

segments.en: And they're not the same as the Chinese peppers and these spicy foods you get in China.
segments.cn: 而且它们与中国的辣椒和这些在中国吃的辣食物不同。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And actually there is one more dish that we didn't mention in the dialogue, actually, but is very famous all around the United States.
segments.cn: 其实还有一道菜我们在对话中没有提到，但在美国非常有名。

segments.en: It's called chop suey.
segments.cn: 它叫杂碎。

segments.en: Chop suey.
segments.cn: 杂碎。

segments.en: And many people have argued about where the name comes from.
segments.cn: 很多人争论这个名字的来源。

segments.en: Yeah, yes.
segments.cn: 是的，没错。

segments.en: But chop suey is just basically like everything chopped up and fried together, right?
segments.cn: 但杂碎基本上就是把所有东西切碎一起炒，对吧？

segments.en: It's like stir fried vegetables and meat.
segments.cn: 就是炒蔬菜和肉。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: And all put together in just a bowl.
segments.cn: 然后放在一个碗里。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Well, my favorite thing about the American Chinese food that we get is that we get it in these little boxes.
segments.cn: 嗯，我最喜欢的美国中餐是我们用这些小盒子装的。

segments.en: They're very cute.
segments.cn: 它们非常可爱。

segments.en: And you take them home and you open them up and every food has a box.
segments.cn: 你把它们带回家，打开，每种食物都有一个盒子。

segments.en: And then at the end, you also get a fortune cookie, which is a very small cookie.
segments.cn: 然后最后，你还会得到一个幸运饼干，这是一个非常小的饼干。

segments.en: And inside there's a piece of paper.
segments.cn: 里面有一张纸。

segments.en: So don't eat the paper.
segments.cn: 所以不要吃纸。

segments.en: And the paper has a fortune for you.
segments.cn: 纸上有你的运势。

segments.en: You will be very lucky today.
segments.cn: 你今天会很幸运。

segments.en: Or your favorite number is 17.
segments.cn: 或者你最喜欢的数字是17。

segments.en: Right, right.
segments.cn: 对，对。

segments.en: And they're very cute.
segments.cn: 它们非常可爱。

segments.en: Actually, you can see these boxes that Catherine mentions on our lesson page.
segments.cn: 其实，你可以在我们的课程页面上看到凯瑟琳提到的这些盒子。

segments.en: It's the lesson photo.
segments.cn: 这是课程照片。

segments.en: And it's, as you said, very, very common.
segments.cn: 而且正如你所说，非常非常常见。

segments.en: Each dish is put in this little box.
segments.cn: 每道菜都放在这个小盒子里。

segments.en: So if you ever get Chinese food, you'll see people carrying these little boxes around because they're very convenient and easy to carry.
segments.cn: 所以如果你吃中餐，你会看到人们提着这些小盒子，因为它们非常方便，易于携带。

segments.en: But the fortune cookie thing is also very common.
segments.cn: 但幸运饼干的事情也很常见。

segments.en: I was actually very surprised when I went to China and there were no fortune cookies.
segments.cn: 我实际上在中国时很惊讶没有幸运饼干。

segments.en: It's weird, isn't it?
segments.cn: 这很奇怪，不是吗？

segments.en: It's funny because we expect these things to be very Chinese.
segments.cn: 这很有趣，因为我们期望这些东西是非常中国的。

segments.en: But in fact, when you come to mainland China, they don't have fortune cookies.
segments.cn: 但实际上，当你来到中国大陆时，他们没有幸运饼干。

segments.en: So I think it's a nice surprise, but also kind of confusing.
segments.cn: 所以我觉得这是一个不错的惊喜，但也有点困惑。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Well, a very interesting topic.
segments.cn: 好吧，这是一个非常有趣的话题。

segments.en: And in the future, we're going to continue doing different lessons about different cuisines.
segments.cn: 在未来，我们将继续进行关于不同美食的不同课程。

segments.en: We have Italian food coming up sometime soon.
segments.cn: 我们很快会有意大利菜。

segments.en: So that's going to be very good as well.
segments.cn: 所以这也会很好。

segments.en: And of course, if you have any lesson suggestions, or maybe you want to suggest the cuisine from your country, you can visit our website, EnglishPod.com, and leave your comments there.
segments.cn: 当然，如果你有任何课程建议，或者想推荐你国家的美食，可以访问我们的网站，EnglishPod.com，并在那里留下你的评论。

segments.en: We hope to see you guys there.
segments.cn: 我们希望在那里见到你们。

segments.en: And until next time, bye.
segments.cn: 下次见，再见。
